item.title: Nominations for EPA Region 4 Rain Catcher Award-Deadline is March 15, 2017
item.description: ATLANTA – For the fourth consecutive year, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is accepting nominations for the Rain Catcher Awards for excellence in implementation of stormwater green infrastructure projects during the past year.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: Watts Bar Reservoir Ecosystem Adjacent to TVA Kingston Facility Returns to Baseline Conditions

item.title: EPA to hold Public Meeting to Announce Environmental Study in Chattanooga
item.description: Atlanta, GA -- The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) will hold a public meeting to announce plans to study lead in residential soil, focusing on a small number of residential areas in downtown/Southside Chattanooga.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Installing Air Monitoring Stations at Memphis Area Transit Facilities
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Hosts National Lead Poisoning Prevention Week in Memphis
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Region 4 announces its activities for National Lead Poisoning Prevention Week. National Lead Poisoning Prevention Week will be observed October 23-29, 2016.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Inducts Second Class of the Environmental Justice Academy
item.description: ATLANTA – Today, representatives from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) inducted 17 participants to the second class of the Environmental Justice (EJ) Academy.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Proposes to Add the Former Custom Cleaners in Memphis, Tennessee to National Priorities List to Reduce Risk to Public Health and Environment
item.description: ATLANTA — The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is adding 10 and proposing to add eight hazardous waste sites to the Superfund program’s National Priorities List (NPL).
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: New Waste Tracking Feature Helps Building Managers Save Money and Support a Healthy Environment
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) unveiled today a waste and materials tracking feature in its Energy Star Portfolio Manager, which is a free benchmarking and tracking tool for commercial building owners and managers.
item.dc:creator: Region 04
